sen.j: 曇鸞（どんらん、tán-luán）は、中国南北朝時代 (中国)の僧侶。
sen.e: Tan-luan was a Buddhist monk who lived during the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties in China.
sen.cmt: Tan-luan と最初を大文字にし、アクセント記号を除きました。http://www.chinmin.edu.tw/%2Fself_store%2F46%2Fself_attach%2F105.pdfヒンズー教などでないことを明確にするため、僧侶に｢仏教の」を入れました。
sen.e: Tan-luan was a Buddhist monk who lived during the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties in China.
Tan-luan was a Buddhist monk who lived during the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties in China.

sen.j: 浄土教中国の開祖とされる。
sen.e: He is thought to be the founder of Jodo kyo (Pure Land teachings) in China.
He is thought to be the founder of Jodo kyo (Pure Land teachings) in China.
He is thought to be the founder of Jodo (Pure Land) sect in China.
sen.cmt: 「Jodo kyo (Pure Land teachings)」→「Jodo (Pure Land) sect」としました。

sen.j: 五台山 (中国)の近く雁門（現在の中国、山西省代県）の生まれ。
sen.e: He was born in Yanmen (present-day Daixian, Shanxi Province, China) close to Mt. Wutai Shan.
He was born in Yanmen (present-day Daixian, Shanxi Province, China) close to Mt. Wutai Shan.
He was born in Yanmen (present-day Daixian, Shanxi Province, China) close to Mt. Wutai Shan.

sen.j: 生没年は不明だが、おおよそ北魏後半から北斉時代の人と思われる。
sen.e: It is not known when he was born or when he died, but it is thought that he lived from a year in the latter half of the Northern Wei period to the Northern Qi period.
sen.cmt: ｢思われる」があるので、「おおよそ」は省きました。「（北魏）後半から」の定訳がわからず、一応 from a year in the latter half of the Northern Wei period としました。
sen.e: It is not known when he was born or when he died, but it is thought that he lived from a year in the latter half of the Northern Wei period to the Northern Qi period.
It is not known when he was born or when he died, but it is thought that he lived from a year in the latter half of the Northern Wei period to the Northern Qi period.

sen.j: 浄土五祖の第一祖、浄土真宗七高僧の第三祖。
sen.e: He was the First Patriarch of the Five Patriarchs of Jodo sect, and the Third of the Seven Patriarchs of Jodo shinshu (True Pure Land Buddhism).
sen.cmt: 原文通り the First Patriarch of the Five Patriarchs と訳しましたが、the First of the Five Patriarchs の方がスマートではないかとも思います。
sen.e: He was the First Patriarch of the Five Patriarchs of Jodo sect, and the Third of the Seven Patriarchs of Jodo shinshu (True Pure Land Buddhism).
He was the First Patriarch of the Five Patriarchs of Jodo sect, and the Third of the Seven Patriarchs of Jodo shin shu (True Pure Land Sect Buddhism).
sen.cmt: 「Jodo shinshu (True Pure Land Buddhism)」→「Jodo shin shu (True Pure Land Sect Buddhism)」としました。

sen.j: 出家して、龍樹系の四論（『中論』、『十二門論』、『大智度論』、『百論』）や『涅槃経』の仏性義を学んだ。
sen.e: After Tan-luan became a monk, he read many books including Four Treatise ("Madhyamaka-karika [Fundamental Verses on the Middle Way]," "Dvadasanikaya Shastra [Twelve Gate Treatise]," "Commentary on the Great Wisdom Sutra, " and "Shatashastra [One Hundred Verses Treatise]") by Nagarjuna and his disciples, and the Sutra of the Great Nirvana, to learn about buddhata.
sen.cmt: 竜樹「系」は、調べた限りでは｢派 school」の名称が見当たらず、「竜樹とその弟子たち」のようでしたので、そう訳しました。 「四論などの（本を多数読んで）、仏性義について学んだ」と、言葉を加えました。「経」のサンスクリット語の表記は、sastra, shastra, karikaといろいろあります。複数の資料から英訳を引いたため、ここでは残念ながら統一できておりません。また、『大智度論』と『涅槃経』のサンスクリット語表記は見つけられませんでしたので、英語名のみ書いております。
sen.e: After Tan-luan became a monk, he read many books including Four Treatise ("Madhyamaka-karika [Fundamental Verses on the Middle Way]," "Dvadasanikaya Shastra [Twelve Gate Treatise]," "Commentary on the Great Wisdom Sutra, " and "Shatashastra [One Hundred Verses Treatise]") by Nagarjuna and his disciples, and the Sutra of the Great Nirvana, to learn about buddhata.

After Tan-luan became a monk, he read many books including Four Treatise ("Madhyamaka-karika [Fundamental Verses on the Middle Way]," "Dvadasanikaya Shastra [Twelve Gate Treatise]," "Commentary on the Great Wisdom Sutra, " and "Shatashastra [One Hundred Verses Treatise]") by Nagarjuna and his disciples, and the Sutra of the Great Nirvana, to learn about buddhata.

sen.j: ところが『大集経』（だいじっきょう）の注釈の最中に病に倒れた。
sen.e: However, while he was annotating Mahsamnipata sutra, he became sick.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, while he was annotating Mahsamnipata sutra, he became sick.
However, while he was annotating "Mahsamnipata sutra," he became sick.

sen.j: 不老長寿の術を茅山の陶弘景について学び「仙経」を得た。
sen.e: He studied the secret art of eternal youth and longevity from Tao Hong-jing in Maoshan and obtained '仙経 Sutra.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「仙経」定訳不明
sen.e: He studied the secret art of eternal youth and longevity from Tao Hong-jing in Maoshan and obtained '仙経 Sutra.'
He studied the secret art of eternal youth and longevity from Tao Hong-jing in Maoshan and obtained 'Sengyo (Taoist bible).'

sen.j: 帰る途中、洛陽で菩提流支（ぼだいるし）に出会った。
sen.e: On the way back home he met Bodhiruci in Luoyang.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the way back home he met Bodhiruci in Luoyang.
On the way back home he met Bodhiruci in Luoyang.

sen.j: 仏教にこそ不死の教えあると諭され、『観無量寿経』を授けられた。
sen.e: Bodhiruci persuaded him that it was Buddhism that contained the true teachings of eternal life, and gave him "Kan Muryoju-kyo Sutra" (Meditation Sutra).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「こそ」という意味で 自然な英文となるようtrue を加えました。どういうわけか、無量寿経はSutra of Immeasurable Lifeで、観無量寿経はMeditation Sutraです。http://www.jodo.org/terminology/japanese.html
sen.e: Bodhiruci persuaded him that it was Buddhism that contained the true teachings of eternal life, and gave him "Kan Muryoju-kyo Sutra" (Meditation Sutra).
Bodhiruci persuaded him that it was Buddhism that contained the true teachings of eternal life, and gave him "Kan Muryoju-kyo Sutra" (Meditation Sutra).

sen.j: そこで、曇鸞は「仙経」を焼き捨てて、浄土教に入った。
sen.e: Therefore, Tan-luan burned '仙経 Sutra,' and was converted to Jodo kyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処この「入った」は「改宗した」として訳しました。
sen.e: Therefore, Tan-luan burned '仙経 Sutra,' and was converted to Jodo kyo.
Therefore, Tan-luan burned 'Sengyo (Taoist bible),' and was converted to Jodo sect.
sen.cmt: 仙経→Sengyo (Taoist bible)「Jodo kyo」→「Jodo sect」としました。

sen.j: 研鑚に勤め、并州の大巌寺に住し、後に石壁の玄中寺に入り、さらに汾州平遥山の遥山寺に移って没した。
sen.e: He kept studying, and became the chief priest of 大巌寺 Temple in Bingzhou, moved to the Xuanzhongsi Temple in Shibi, then to 遥山寺 Temple in Mt. 平遥山 of Fenzhou, where he died.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「大巌寺」「平遥山」「遥山寺」の中国名の英語表記を調べきれませんでした。
sen.e: He kept studying, and became the chief priest of 大巌寺 Temple in Bingzhou, moved to the Xuanzhongsi Temple in Shibi, then to 遥山寺 Temple in Mt. 平遥山 of Fenzhou, where he died.

He kept studying, and became the chief priest of Daigan-ji Temple(大巌寺) in Bingzhou, moved to the Xuanzhongsi Temple in Shibi, then to Yozan-ji Temple (遥山寺) in Mt. Pingyao (平遥山) of Fenzhou, where he died.
sen.cmt: 大巌寺→Daigan-ji Temple(大巌寺)[定訳不明]遥山寺→Yozan-ji Temple (遥山寺)[定訳不明]平遥山→Mt. Pingyao (平遥山)[定訳不明]

sen.j: 勅によって汾州西秦陵の文谷に葬られた。
sen.e: By the Imperial order he was buried at 西秦陵の文谷 in Fenzhou.
sen.cmt: 「西秦陵」「文谷」の中国名の英語表記を調べきれませんでした。
sen.e: By Imperial order he was buried at 西秦陵の文谷 in Fenzhou.
By Imperial order he was buried at Text Valley (文谷) of West Qinling (西秦陵) in Fenzhou.
sen.cmt: 西秦陵→West Qinling(西秦陵)[定訳不明]文谷→Text Valley(文谷)[定訳不明]

sen.j: 『無量寿経優婆提舎願生偈註』…一般には、略して『浄土論註』、『往生論註』と呼び、『論註』とも呼ぶ。
sen.e: "Muryoju-kyo Ubadaisha Ganshoge-chu" (Commentary on Upadeśa on the Sutra of Immeasurable Life) is usually abbreviated to "Jodo ron chu" (Commentary on Treatise on the Pure Land), or "Ojo ron chu" (往生論注), or more simply, "Ron chu" "論註".
sen.cmt: 「…」を「は」として主語述語のある文としました。以下同様です。自然な英語になるよう、「略して・・と呼ぶ」を「略した」としました。『往生論注』および『論注』定訳不明 これらの本は中国語で書かれたと思われますので、日本語の読みをローマ字表記で表す意味があるかどうか悩みましたが、一応書きました。以下同様です。
sen.e: "Muryoju-kyo Ubadaisha Ganshoge-chu" (Commentary on Upadeśa on the Sutra of Immeasurable Life) is usually abbreviated to "Jodo ron chu" (Commentary on Treatise on the Pure Land), or "Ojo ron chu" (往生論注), or more simply, "Ron chu" "論註".

"Muryoju-kyo Ubadaisha Ganshoge-chu" (Commentary on Upadeśa on the Sutra of Immeasurable Life) is usually abbreviated to "Jodo ron chu" (Commentary on Treatise on the Pure Land), or "Ojo ron chu" (往生論注), or more simply, "Ron chu" (論註).

sen.j: 天親（世親）撰述の『無量寿経優婆提舎願生偈』（正式名『無量寿経優婆提舎願生偈』）の註釈書である。
sen.e: This is a commentary on "Treatise on the Pure Land" (its formal name: "Muryoju-kyo Ubadaisha Ganshoge" [Upadesa on the Sutra of Immeasurable Life]) written by Tenjin (Seshin) (Vasubandhu).
sen.cmt: 前文の英訳の中に、すでに同じ意味のことが書かれているように思いますが、一応原文通り訳しました。『無量寿経優婆提舎願生偈』（正式名『無量寿経優婆提舎願生偈』 ： この二つの名前は同じに見えますので、前文より略称と思われるものを取りました。「撰述」の定訳は不明ですが、「撰」は編集(広字苑）とありました。が、written by Vasubandhuと[http://www.chinmin.edu.tw/%2Fself_store%2F46%2Flf_attach%2F105.pdf]にはありましたので、一応 writtenとしました。Tenjin は原語であるインド名、世親は中国での名、Vasubandhuはサンスクリット語の名前のアルファベット表記です。
sen.e: This is a commentary on "Treatise on the Pure Land" (its formal name: "Muryoju-kyo Ubadaisha Ganshoge" [Upadesa on the Sutra of Immeasurable Life]) written by Tenjin (Seshin) (Vasubandhu).
This is a commentary on "Treatise on the Pure Land" (its formal name: "Muryoju-kyo Ubadaisha Ganshoge" [Upadesa on the Sutra of Immeasurable Life]) written by Tenjin (Seshin) (Vasubandhu).
sen.cmt: 全角スペースを半角スペースにしました。

sen.j: （正確には、『浄土論』自体が『無量寿経』の注釈書なので、再註釈にあたる。）
sen.e: (To be precise, "Treatise on the Pure Land" itself was the commentary on "Sutra of Immeasurable Life"; Tan-luan annotated the commentary again.)
(To be precise, "Treatise on the Pure Land" itself was the commentary on "Sutra of Immeasurable Life"; Tan-luan annotated the commentary again.)

sen.j: 末法無仏の時代には、他力の信心による浄土往生による成仏以外にないと説いたものである。
sen.e: He argued that in the days of mappo (the end of the Dharma) without a buddha, one could attain nirvana only through Birth in the Pure Land by believing in Tariki (Other Power).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処原文では、「他力の信心による浄土往生による成仏以外に『何が』ない」のかはっきりしません。疑問は残りますが、一応「成仏するには、他力の信心による浄土往生以外にない」と訳しました。「無仏」定訳不明。一応 without a buddha としました。
sen.e: He argued that in the days of mappo (the end of the Dharma) without a buddha, one could attain nirvana only through Birth in the Pure Land by believing in Tariki (Other Power).
He argued that in the days of mappo (the end of the Dharma) without a buddha, one could attain nirvana only through Birth in the Pure Land by believing in Tariki (Other Power).

sen.j: ことに下巻の末尾にすべてが他力のはたらきであると論証していく論調は、さながらドミノ倒しのような明快さである。
sen.e: At the end of its second volume, he proved that Other Power was the source of everything so logically and explicitly that one would feel as if watching the dominoes falling down one after another.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「ことに」は強調であるとして、自然な英文になるよう、so that に含めました。「すべて」が、何の全てなのかはっきりしませんが、一応原文通りeverythingと訳しました。 everything (or every event) of a human life, every Birth in the Pure Land のあたりかな、という気はします。all beings も資料にはでてきます。他力の「はたらき」はmanuever かと悩みましたが、一応「他力が全ての根源」としました。「明快に」を logically and explicitly としました
sen.e: At the end of the second volume, he proved that Other Power was the source of everything so logically and explicitly that one would feel as if one was watching the dominoes falling down one after another.

At the end of the second volume, he proved that Other Power was the source of everything so logically and explicitly that one would feel as if one was watching the dominoes falling down one after another.

sen.j: このため、続く道綽・善導、さらに日本の源信_(僧侶)・法然・親鸞はこの論書によって論を進めている。
sen.e: The priests who followed him such as Tao-chuo and Shaodao as well as Genshin, Honen, and Shinran in Japan adopted Tan-luan's logic in their own theories because of its persuasiveness.
sen.cmt: 「このため」を「彼の理論は説得力があるので」と説明しました。(僧侶）の位置を変え、源信だけでなく全員につくようにしました。
sen.e: The priests who followed him such as Tao-chuo and Shaodao as well as Genshin, Honen, and Shinran in Japan adopted Tan-luan's logic in their own theories because of its persuasiveness.
The priests who followed him such as Tao-chuo and Shan-dao as well as Genshin, Honen, and Shinran in Japan adopted Tan-luan's logic in their own theories because of its persuasiveness.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: ことに親鸞の教義の根幹を成している。
sen.e: Most of all, his theory forms the basis of Shinran's doctrine.
Most of all, his theory forms the basis of Shinran's doctrine.
Most of all, his theory forms the basis of Shinran's doctrine.

sen.j: 『讃阿弥陀仏偈』…阿弥陀如来への讃美の偈文。
sen.e: "San Amida butsu ge" (Hymns in Praise of Amida Buddha) is a tribute to Amida tathagata in poetic verse.
"San Amida butsu ge" (Hymns in Praise of Amida Buddha) is a tribute to Amida tathagata in poetic verse.
"San Amida butsu ge" (Hymns in Praise of Amida Buddha) is a tribute to Amida tathagata in poetic verse.

sen.j: 難行道を捨てて本願力にすべてを任せてしまう易行道につくべきことを宣言した。
sen.e: He declared that one should discard Difficult Path and take Easy Path where one entrust everything to Amida's power described in the Original Vow.
sen.cmt: 「本願力」定訳不明。一応 Amida's power described in the Original Vow としました。
sen.e: He declared that one should discard the Difficult Path and take the Easy Path where one entrusts everything to Amida's power described in the Original Vow.
He declared that one should discard the Difficult Path and take the Easy Path where one entrusts everything to Amida's power described in the Original Vow.

sen.j: 浄土教義を確立した。
sen.e: Thus he established the doctrine of Pure Land teachings.
sen.cmt: 前文からの流れをスムースにし、項目の最後をひきしめるため、「こうして」と「彼は」をおぎないました。
sen.e: Thus he established the doctrine of Pure Land teachings.
Thus he established the doctrine of Jodo sect.
